divs: sighting detailsi was in the area of town known as eastside, i was walking to the store sometime between 8:15 and 8:30pm. when i walk at night i like to look at the stares, naming constellations and thinking maybe i'll get lucky and see a ufo. i remember looking to the north\north east and saw what i initially thought was a plane. we have an aiport and i see planes coming and going all the time, for about maybe 20 seconds or so i didn't think much of it but a few things about it didn't seem quite right. most lights i see on planes have a distinctive pattern of arrangement, the way they blink and such. but this was just one blinking red light, it must have been pretty far away, because i couldn't tell if it was a strobing light or a light that just blinked off and on. at this point i still thought it could be a plane or a helicopter(we also have a coast guard airport). the light was not stationary, it was moving west from what i could tell, and very slowly. slower than a plane and i believe slower than a helicopter would be moving. i must have watched it for about 5 minutes maybe, and from what i could tell it must have been moving rather slowly for an aircraft. if i had a ruler at arm length it would have covered a distance of more than a foot, maybe a foot and a half. as far as i could tell it didn't make any sound, but that could have been due to the distance. at about halfway through the sighting a plane i see coming and going all the time flew through my field of vision, it was closer to me than the light was so i could hear the plane. i recognized its lights pattern and the sound of its engines, so i had a reference to what a plane would look like at that moment in view while watching the other light, and there was a definite difference. the plane flew into my field of view and disappeared in under a minute, meanwhile this light is still moving at a rather slow speed. some people might say it was a flare, this was not a flare. flares don't move horizontally like this, they float down to the ground and their light flickers, they dont have a consistant blinking light. i was in a hurry so i started walking again, i couldn't have walked more than 10 feet before i truned back to look at it again and it was gone. no zoom off into the distance, just gone. it was a clear night so it couldn't have just disappeared behind some clouds, the only clouds were way off into the distance, hugging the horizon. that was the last i saw of it sadly.
Summary: Blinking red light in the sky
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in Coos Bay
There were no other sightings in Coos Bay on or around December 1st 2009
